articles.title: Housing designed to combat loneliness wins top architecture award
articles.summary: Appleby Blue Almshouse in London wins the Royal Institute of British Architects' Stirling Prize.
articles.content:
Housing designed to combat loneliness wins top architecture award

6 hours ago Share Save Ian Youngs Culture reporter Share Save

Philip Vile/Riba

A modern answer to the traditional almshouse, designed to combat loneliness, has won a prestigious architecture award for Britain's best new building. Appleby Blue Almshouse, which provides affordable flats for over-65s in Southwark, south London, has won this year's Royal Institute of British Architechts' (Riba) Stirling Prize. The complex, in Bermondsey, has 59 flats plus communal facilities, including a roof garden, courtyard and community kitchen. The Stirling Prize judges said it "sets an ambitious standard for social housing among older people".

Philip Vile/Riba

Architects Witherford Watson Mann have crafted "high-quality" and "thoughtful" spaces to create environments that truly care for their residents", according to jury member Ingrid Schroder, director of the Architectural Association (AA) School of Architecture.

Philip Vile/Riba

The building was praised for its "generous" homes, terracotta-paved hallways with benches and plants, and a water feature that gives the building the "sense of a woodland oasis". That all creates an "aspirational living environment" that stands "in stark contrast to the institutional atmosphere often associated with older people's housing", Riba said.

Philip Vile/Riba

The Appleby Blue Almshouse was built on the site of an old care home by United St Saviour's Charity, which subsidises the flats for people on low incomes. Almshouses were traditionally built from the Middle Ages to provide charitable accommodation for people in need.

Philip Vile/Riba

Appleby Blue beat a range of other nominated buildings and architecture projects to this year's Stirling Prize, ranging from the restoration of the Big Ben tower in London to a new fashion college campus, a science laboratory and an "inventive" home extension. The other contenders were:

House of Commons Rory Gaylor The Elizabeth Tower Hastings House

This represents a meaningful social impact by improving quality of life for a vulnerable population and setting a new standard in social housing. articles.personality_title: London housing for older people wins top architecture prize for fighting loneliness
articles.personality_presentation:
**Context** – In London, many older people live alone and can feel lonely. Traditional housing for older adults can sometimes feel cold or like an institution, which may not help people feel connected or cared for.

**What happened** – A new housing project called Appleby Blue Almshouse in Southwark, London, won the Royal Institute of British Architects’ (Riba) Stirling Prize. This prize is given to the best new building in Britain. The Appleby Blue Almshouse offers 59 affordable flats for people over 65, with shared spaces like a roof garden, courtyard, and community kitchen to encourage socializing.

**Impact** – The building is designed to feel warm and welcoming, with features like terracotta hallways, benches, plants, and a water feature that makes it feel like a peaceful woodland. This design helps fight loneliness by encouraging residents to spend time together in beautiful, thoughtful spaces. The project sets a new example for how housing for older people can be both affordable and inspiring.

**What’s next step** – The success of Appleby Blue Almshouse might inspire other architects and charities to create more housing that focuses on community and wellbeing for older adults. It shows how good design can improve lives and could influence future social housing projects.

**One-sentence takeaway** – Appleby Blue Almshouse wins a top architecture prize by creating affordable, welcoming homes that help older people avoid loneliness through thoughtful design and shared spaces.
articles.personality_title_fr: Un logement londonien pour les personnes âgées récompensé pour lutter contre la solitude
articles.personality_presentation_fr:
**Contexte** – À Londres, de nombreuses personnes âgées vivent seules et peuvent se sentir isolées. Les logements traditionnels pour les seniors peuvent parfois sembler froids ou institutionnels, ce qui ne favorise pas le lien social ou le bien-être.

**Ce qui s’est passé** – Un nouveau projet de logement appelé Appleby Blue Almshouse, situé à Southwark, Londres, a remporté le Stirling Prize de l’Institut royal des architectes britanniques (Riba). Ce prix récompense le meilleur nouveau bâtiment en Grande-Bretagne. Appleby Blue Almshouse propose 59 appartements abordables pour les plus de 65 ans, avec des espaces communs comme un jardin sur le toit, une cour et une cuisine communautaire pour encourager la vie sociale.

**Impact** – Le bâtiment est conçu pour être chaleureux et accueillant, avec des couloirs en terre cuite, des bancs, des plantes et une fontaine qui donnent une ambiance de forêt paisible. Ce design aide à lutter contre la solitude en invitant les résidents à passer du temps ensemble dans des espaces réfléchis et agréables. Ce projet donne un nouvel exemple de logement abordable et inspirant pour les personnes âgées.

**Prochaine étape** – Le succès d’Appleby Blue Almshouse pourrait encourager d’autres architectes et organismes caritatifs à créer davantage de logements axés sur la communauté et le bien-être des seniors. Il montre comment un bon design peut améliorer la vie et pourrait influencer les futurs projets de logements sociaux.

**En une phrase** – Appleby Blue Almshouse remporte un grand prix d’architecture en offrant des logements abordables et conviviaux qui aident les personnes âgées à éviter la solitude grâce à un design réfléchi et des espaces partagés.
articles.personality_title_es: Vivienda en Londres para personas mayores gana premio por combatir la soledad
articles.personality_presentation_es:
**Contexto** – En Londres, muchas personas mayores viven solas y pueden sentirse solas. Las viviendas tradicionales para adultos mayores a veces parecen frías o institucionales, lo que no ayuda a que las personas se sientan conectadas o cuidadas.

**Qué pasó** – Un nuevo proyecto de vivienda llamado Appleby Blue Almshouse en Southwark, Londres, ganó el Stirling Prize del Royal Institute of British Architects (Riba). Este premio se otorga al mejor edificio nuevo en Gran Bretaña. Appleby Blue Almshouse ofrece 59 apartamentos asequibles para personas mayores de 65 años, con espacios compartidos como un jardín en la azotea, un patio y una cocina comunitaria para fomentar la convivencia.

**Impacto** – El edificio está diseñado para ser cálido y acogedor, con pasillos de terracota, bancos, plantas y una fuente que crea un ambiente de bosque tranquilo. Este diseño ayuda a combatir la soledad invitando a los residentes a pasar tiempo juntos en espacios pensados y agradables. El proyecto establece un nuevo ejemplo de cómo puede ser una vivienda asequible e inspiradora para personas mayores.

**Próximo paso** – El éxito de Appleby Blue Almshouse podría inspirar a otros arquitectos y organizaciones benéficas a crear más viviendas que se centren en la comunidad y el bienestar de los adultos mayores. Muestra cómo un buen diseño puede mejorar vidas y podría influir en futuros proyectos de vivienda social.

**Una frase clave** – Appleby Blue Almshouse gana un premio de arquitectura importante al crear hogares asequibles y acogedores que ayudan a las personas mayores a evitar la soledad mediante un diseño pensado y espacios compartidos.

articles.title: A. Tzitzikostas from New York: ‘EU and USA are creating the largest travel market in the world’
articles.summary: In his opening speech at the "Transatlantic Skift Summit," Mr. Tzitzikostas referred to the importance of transatlantic travel flows, the new strategy for European tourism that he is formulating, the challenges facing the mobility sector, as well as the opportunities arising from innovation, the diversification of tourism habits, sustainable and multimodal transport.
articles.content:
In his opening speech at the “Transatlantic Skift Summit,” Mr. Tzitzikostas referred to the importance of transatlantic travel flows, the new strategy for European tourism that he is formulating, the challenges facing the mobility sector, as well as the opportunities arising from innovation, the diversification of tourism habits, sustainable and multimodal transport.

The opening speech at the “Transatlantic Skift Summit” in New York was delivered by the Commissioner for Sustainable Transport and Tourism, Apostolos Tzitzikostas, during his visit to New York, USA.

This is one of the leading forums for tourism worldwide (Transatlantic Summit), organized by the European Travel Commission, bringing together 150 senior tourism executives representing the entire transatlantic travel ecosystem to examine the evolving dynamics of travel between Europe and North America, as stated in the related announcement.

The major airlines and travel agents, heads of tourist destinations and destination management organizations, as well as pioneers in travel technology, highlighted, among other things, that the transatlantic corridor remains the most significant in global travel and is shaped by the evolving demands of travelers, geopolitical changes, and the acceleration of digital innovation.

At the Transatlantic Summit, participants also explored opportunities to strengthen collaborations to address modern mobility challenges and to shape a new framework for more, better, and more sustainable travel.

In his speech, Mr. Tzitzikostas referred to the importance of transatlantic travel flows, the new strategy for European tourism he is formulating, the challenges facing the mobility sector, and the opportunities arising from innovation, the diversification of tourism habits, sustainable and multimodal transport. He also mentioned the significance of the EU-US relationship as crucial for global tourism.

“The transatlantic corridor is the busiest route in the world,” he said, adding immediately: “It connects our people, builds bridges, and gives our economies on both sides of the Atlantic a vital economic boost. Last year, nearly 10 million Europeans traveled to the USA, while Americans spent over 34 million nights in Europe.”

“I think it is fair to say that we have a mutually beneficial, deeply enriched, and extremely valuable relationship,” Mr. Tzitzikostas added, emphasizing that “some of these trips are for business reasons and others for leisure. However, all create jobs, income, and prosperity on both sides of the Atlantic.”

“The diversity we offer to visitors makes tourists return,” he continued. “For Europe, the USA is the most important long-haul market. American visitors stay longer and spend more than the average traveler. That is why, together with the European Travel Commission, we have launched campaigns across the USA, not only to promote our most iconic destinations but also to highlight lesser-known areas. And we do this because we want to distribute the benefits more evenly across all regions and throughout the year.”

“You will see this approach reflected in our upcoming first European tourism strategy, which I will present by 2026. It will focus on three key priorities: transitioning destinations to more sustainable and resilient models, promoting digital innovation for the benefit of both travelers and businesses, and deepening our international partnerships with key allies, starting here in the USA, our closest and most valuable ally. Each of these priorities offers opportunities, from innovation in digital payments to diversification and creating a global standard for sustainability,” said Mr. Tzitzikostas.

Referring to modern challenges, the Commissioner emphasized that the EU and the USA are addressing them with critical adjustments. “Europe is investing in high-speed rail and the issuance of multimodal transport tickets. The USA is investing in modernizing its infrastructure. Together, we can make travel smoother, more reliable, and more sustainable.”

As Mr. Tzitzikostas noted, “tourism is more than an industry. It is a ‘soft power’ whose value we must never underestimate. Because it means millions of jobs, billions in revenue, and ties between communities across borders. Together, the EU and the USA create the largest travel and tourism market in the world. Disruptions may sometimes be inevitable, but with solid partnerships and a shared vision, there is literally no barrier we cannot overcome.”

On the sidelines of the forum, the Commissioner held meetings and discussions with tourism stakeholders and officials from the EU and the USA, where they discussed strengthening Europe’s position in the American market, reviewing trends and challenges, and gathering data that will also feed into the new unified European tourism strategy that the Commissioner will present next year.

During his stay in New York, Mr. Tzitzikostas had private meetings with the Archbishop of America Elpidophoros, the EU Ambassador to the United Nations, Stavros Lambrinidis, the Consul General of Greece in New York, Ifigenia Kanara, the President of the Hellenic American Chamber of Commerce (HACC) Eftychia Pylariou-Piper, and senior officials from US tourism organizations. (16/10/25)

articles.personality_title: EU and USA join forces to build the world’s largest travel market
articles.personality_presentation:
**Context** – The European Union (EU) and the United States (USA) are important partners in global tourism. Every year, millions of people travel between these two regions, making the transatlantic route the busiest travel corridor in the world. Both sides face challenges like climate change, changing travel habits, and the need for better, greener transport.

**What happened** – Apostolos Tzitzikostas, the EU Commissioner for Sustainable Transport and Tourism, spoke at the Transatlantic Skift Summit in New York. He shared plans for a new European tourism strategy to be released in 2026. This strategy will focus on making travel more sustainable, using digital technology to improve experiences, and strengthening partnerships with the USA. The summit brought together 150 tourism leaders from Europe and North America to discuss how to improve travel and tourism together.

**Impact** – This collaboration is important because it creates the largest travel market in the world, linking millions of travelers and supporting many jobs and businesses. By working together, the EU and USA aim to make travel smoother, more environmentally friendly, and more diverse. For example, Europe is investing in high-speed trains and easier ticket options, while the USA is modernizing its travel infrastructure. These efforts will help tourists enjoy safer and greener trips.

**What's next step** – The EU will present its new tourism strategy in 2026, focusing on sustainability, innovation, and stronger international ties. Meanwhile, officials from both sides will continue meeting to share ideas and data. This ongoing work will help shape future travel policies and encourage more people to explore new destinations responsibly.

**One-sentence takeaway** – The EU and USA are working together to create a stronger, greener, and more connected travel market that benefits millions of people on both sides of the Atlantic.
articles.personality_title_fr: L’UE et les États-Unis unissent leurs forces pour créer le plus grand marché du voyage au monde
articles.personality_presentation_fr:
**Contexte** – L’Union européenne (UE) et les États-Unis (USA) sont des partenaires clés du tourisme mondial. Chaque année, des millions de personnes voyagent entre ces deux régions, faisant de la route transatlantique la plus fréquentée au monde. Ces deux parties doivent relever des défis comme le changement climatique, les nouvelles habitudes de voyage et la nécessité de transports plus écologiques.

**Ce qui s’est passé** – Apostolos Tzitzikostas, Commissaire européen au transport durable et au tourisme, a pris la parole lors du sommet Transatlantic Skift à New York. Il a présenté un nouveau plan pour le tourisme en Europe, qui sera dévoilé en 2026. Ce plan vise à rendre les voyages plus durables, à utiliser la technologie numérique pour améliorer l’expérience des voyageurs, et à renforcer la coopération avec les États-Unis. Le sommet a réuni 150 dirigeants du tourisme d’Europe et d’Amérique du Nord pour discuter d’améliorations communes.

**Impact** – Cette collaboration est importante car elle crée le plus grand marché du voyage au monde, reliant des millions de voyageurs et soutenant de nombreux emplois et entreprises. En travaillant ensemble, l’UE et les USA souhaitent rendre les voyages plus fluides, écologiques et diversifiés. Par exemple, l’Europe investit dans les trains à grande vitesse et la simplification des billets, tandis que les États-Unis modernisent leurs infrastructures. Ces efforts permettront aux touristes de voyager de façon plus sûre et plus respectueuse de l’environnement.

**Prochaine étape** – L’UE présentera sa nouvelle stratégie touristique en 2026, axée sur la durabilité, l’innovation et des liens internationaux renforcés. En attendant, les responsables des deux côtés continueront à échanger des idées et des données. Ce travail permettra de définir les futures politiques de voyage et d’encourager les visiteurs à découvrir de nouvelles destinations de manière responsable.

**Résumé en une phrase** – L’UE et les États-Unis collaborent pour créer un marché du voyage plus fort, plus écologique et mieux connecté, au bénéfice de millions de personnes de part et d’autre de l’Atlantique.
articles.personality_title_es: La UE y EE. UU. unen fuerzas para crear el mayor mercado de viajes del mundo
articles.personality_presentation_es:
**Contexto** – La Unión Europea (UE) y Estados Unidos (EE. UU.) son socios clave en el turismo mundial. Cada año, millones de personas viajan entre estas dos regiones, haciendo que la ruta transatlántica sea la más transitada del mundo. Ambas partes enfrentan desafíos como el cambio climático, nuevas formas de viajar y la necesidad de transportes más sostenibles.

**Qué pasó** – Apostolos Tzitzikostas, Comisionado de la UE para el Transporte Sostenible y el Turismo, habló en la Cumbre Transatlantic Skift en Nueva York. Presentó un nuevo plan para el turismo europeo que se dará a conocer en 2026. Este plan busca hacer los viajes más sostenibles, usar tecnología digital para mejorar la experiencia y fortalecer la cooperación con EE. UU. La cumbre reunió a 150 líderes turísticos de Europa y América del Norte para discutir cómo mejorar juntos el turismo.

**Impacto** – Esta colaboración es importante porque crea el mayor mercado de viajes del mundo, conectando a millones de viajeros y apoyando muchos empleos y negocios. Trabajando juntos, la UE y EE. UU. quieren que viajar sea más fácil, ecológico y diverso. Por ejemplo, Europa invierte en trenes de alta velocidad y en boletos más simples, mientras EE. UU. moderniza sus infraestructuras. Estos esfuerzos harán que los viajes sean más seguros y respetuosos con el medio ambiente.

**Próximo paso** – La UE presentará su nueva estrategia turística en 2026, centrada en la sostenibilidad, la innovación y alianzas internacionales más fuertes. Mientras tanto, los responsables de ambos lados seguirán compartiendo ideas y datos. Este trabajo ayudará a definir políticas futuras y a animar a más personas a descubrir nuevos destinos de forma responsable.

**Resumen en una frase** – La UE y EE. UU. trabajan juntos para crear un mercado de viajes más fuerte, más verde y mejor conectado que beneficie a millones de personas a ambos lados del Atlántico.
